text: City traffic police implemented arrangements for the 12-day Lalbagh flower show from Thursday, urging visitors to use public transport to lessen traffic and parking issues. Specific parking spots were designated at various locations, while parking restrictions were enforced on several roads around Lalbagh. The event concluded on August 19, ensuring a smooth experience for attendees.
title: Traffic curbs for Bengaluru's Lalbagh flower show from today

text: A 19-year-old woman named Likitha was murdered by her husband, Naveen, just hours after their marriage in Kolar Gold Fields. The incident occurred in Chambarasanahalli village on Wednesday evening. Naveen attacked Likitha with a machete at his uncle's house. Police are investigating the motive behind the attack and how Naveen obtained the weapon.
title: Karnataka's newlyweds fight hours after marriage; woman found dead, man battling for life

text: The plan to develop a second international airport for Bengaluru conflicted with deputy CM DK Shivakumar's project to build a 250-metre sky deck in Hemmigepura. The new airport, potentially in Bidadi or Harohalli, would restrict structures over 180 metres, jeopardizing the sky deck proposal. A decision was expected after a meeting with CM Siddaramaiah.
title: Proposed 2nd Bengaluru airport may derail DKS' sky deck project
Post 45 days of hunt, cop chases down man wanted in 40 cases
Hardik powers SUCC (1) to title
Man assaulted for taking photo of SUV flouting rule

text: Bengaluru's Panathur Road, a key link to Outer Ring Road dotted with multinational companies, witnessed extreme congestion as a 3.5km stretch took commuters an average of 1.2 hours to traverse. Despite promises from officials for road improvements, residents remain skeptical. Public frustration mounted as social media buzzed with shared delays and calls for direct action.
title: Snail’s pace challenge: BBMP’s oversight turns 3.5km into 1.2-hours epic trip

text: Bengaluru's long-standing appeal for metropolitan city status under Income Tax rules was likely unmet, according to the Union finance ministry. Currently, only Mumbai, Kolkata, Delhi, and Chennai residents can claim 50% of their salary as HRA, while Bengaluru is capped at 40%. Local leaders and citizens expressed disappointment at this decision, highlighting its negative impact.
title: ‘Metro’ tag to Bengaluru against tax rationalisation policy: Centre

text: The Karnataka High Court granted relief to Post Graduate medical graduates by staying a July 12 notification mandating compulsory government service registration. Graduates, who completed their courses before the amendment act came into force, argued that the notification disrupted professional and personal obligations. The court sided with the petitioners, challenging the compulsory service act's fairness and relevance.
title: Karnataka HC stays compulsory service order for PG doctors
Dharshan sets new 1,500m mark

text: BBMP announced penalties for owners of vacant plots where garbage has accumulated, in accordance with Solid Waste Management Rules and BBMP Act-2020. Zonal offices will identify such plots, issue fines, and recover waste removal costs along with property taxes. Failure to comply within seven days will result in BBMP clearing the waste and imposing additional costs and interest.
title: Is garbage piling up in your vacant plot? Pay penalty now, says Palike
Court to BBMP: What have you done to prevent accumulation of solid waste?

text: The unrest in Bangladesh affected India's trucking industry, leaving 1,300 trucks stranded at the Benapole border. The All India Motor Transport Congress sought government intervention, leading to the return of trucks. This disruption has halted the daily flow of around 1,000 Indian trucks into Bangladesh, impacting the transport of various goods including auto parts and pharmaceuticals.
title: Bangladesh border: Trucks stranded across border

text: India Inc reframed employee rewards to attract Gen Z, replacing certificates with digital rewards like badges and points for instant satisfaction. Companies such as Epsilon India and Roche Information Solutions introduced tools like 'Citizen of Youniverse' passport and Applause marketplace. Firms like Merck India and Allstate India allowed points and leaderboards to recognize peer achievements.
title: Gen Z effect: Companies gamify employee rewards

text: The sensex soared over 1% on Wednesday with significant gains in 25 of its 30 constituents, driven by a notable recovery in global markets. Despite strong selling by foreign funds, domestic investment supported the market. The sensex closed 875 points higher at 79,468, while the Nifty rose 305 points to finish at 24,298. Midcap and small-cap stocks also performed well.
title: Relief rally: Sensex jumps 875 pts despite FPI selling

text: The political crisis in Bangladesh had led to disruptions for Indian companies operating there. Marico's manufacturing units were shut, but retail activity resumed. VIP Industries, reliant on Bangladesh for sourcing, might shift operations. Pidilite and Dabur were closely monitoring the situation. Sales pressure was anticipated until the crisis was resolved.
title: Bangladesh turmoil hits India Inc’s manufacturing, sourcing

text: Adani Enterprises planned to launch a $1-billion share sale by mid-September, marking its return to the capital market after withdrawing a previous offering due to allegations by Hindenburg Research. The company aims to attract US investors focusing on infrastructure. The sale proceeds will fund green initiatives, and the promoters' stake will be diluted.
title: Adani Enterprise plans to raise $1 billion from share sale

text: India stood to benefit from the political instability in Bangladesh, which was likely to redirect global clothing orders towards it. With a 4% market share in the global textile sector, India could potentially capture an additional 2%. This shift could see international buyers divert 10-15% of their orders in the short term.
title: Bangladesh crisis: Apparel export boost for India

text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed the Opposition's call to remove GST on health and life insurance, highlighting that three-quarters of the collected revenue goes to states. She reminded that taxes on medical insurance existed pre-GST and urged protesters to engage with state finance ministers. Around Rs 12,264 crore of collected GST last year went to states.
title: States get nearly 75% of health, life insurance GST: FM

text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced amendments to the Finance Bill to mitigate the impact of long-term capital gains tax on real estate. Taxpayers can now choose between a new 12.5% tax rate without indexation and the old 20% rate with indexation, opting for whichever is lower for assets acquired before July 23, 2024. The Lok Sabha approved the Bill.
title: Govt amends Budget proposal on realty capital gains formula

text: Tata Motors criticized Maruti Suzuki and Toyota's push for hybrid vehicle incentives, calling it a 'regressive' move that could slow EV adoption and waste government funds. Tata unveiled the Curvv EV and remarked that EVs are essential for meeting net zero emission targets, arguing hybrids do not achieve true zero emissions. Tata on Wednesday drove in the Curvv EV with an entry price of Rs 17.5 lakh (ex-showroom), and will also launch petrol and diesel versions of the vehicle soon.
title: Incentives for hybrids ‘regressive’, says Tata Motors Cars MD

text: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced amendments to the Long-Term Capital Gains tax on real estate, offering taxpayers the option to calculate tax liability using either the old system or reduced rates without indexation. The new rate is 12.5 percent, down from 20 percent. A key amendment in the Bill addresses the restoration of indexation benefit for properties purchased before July 23, 2024.

text: Congress' high command backed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah amid the Muda site allotment case, dismissing chances of his ouster. Despite this, chief ministerial aspirants are lobbying hard for the post. Protests and lobbying efforts continued, with key leaders like DK Shivakumar and others participating in the Janandolan campaign to counter opposition attempts to destabilize the government.

text: BWSSB has prepared to commission Asia's largest water treatment plant at TK Halli, 95km from Bengaluru. The Rs 5,550-crore project aims to pump 775 MLD of Cauvery water to Bengaluru under the Cauvery V Stage project. Initially delayed by the pandemic, the plant is expected to be inaugurated this month, featuring advanced Japanese and French technology.

text: Healthcare systems have increasingly prioritized non-communicable diseases like cancer and diabetes. Siemens Healthineers is leveraging AI for personalized treatment plans, especially in areas with limited physician access. Their work in Bengaluru includes software innovations and 'Make in India' initiatives. The company is also expanding its cancer care ecosystem with advanced imaging and radiation therapy technologies.

text: Indian companies like Vodafone Idea and IndianOil have embraced AI across operations, enhancing efficiency and data handling. However, as AI's role grows, the need for robust governance becomes essential. Both companies have focused on data governance, privacy protection, and continuous system monitoring, while also implementing extensive employee training to ensure responsible AI use. To address this challenge and build trust in AI, Hitesh says, they implemented a data engineering process.

text: Smaller urban centers and rural regions in India have been the driving forces behind the $130-billion lifestyle market, primarily led by the fashion segment. Online platforms have played a critical role in democratizing access, with about 50% of over 175 million e-shoppers from households with annual incomes below Rs 10 lakh.

text: Tata Power acquired a 40% stake in Bhutan's Khorlochhu Hydro Power project for Rs 830 crore, aiming to enhance its green energy portfolio. The 600MW project requires an investment of Rs 6,900 crore. Additionally, Tata Power announced the termination of its global depository shares from the Luxembourg stock exchange due to inactivity.
title: Tata Power to buy 40% in Bhutan hydro project

text: Manish Tiwary, Amazon India's head, resigned after eight years with the company. Tiwary, who joined in 2016 and became country manager in 2020, will remain until October for a smooth transition. This departure happens amid fierce competition in India's e-commerce market dominated by players like Walmart's Flipkart and SoftBank-backed Meesho.

text: SBI MD Challa Sreenivasulu Setty was appointed as the new chairman of India’s largest bank on August 28, succeeding Dinesh Khara. Setty has been with SBI since 1988 and has held various key positions. His appointment follows the bank's significant turnaround, achieving record profits and asset quality. Deputy MD Rana Ashutosh Kumar Singh was promoted as MD.
title: SBI MD Setty to succeed Khara as chairman

text: The Shapoorji Pallonji Group offered a security cover more than six times the Rs 15,000 crore loan from Power Finance Corporation. They secured the loan with land parcels and Tata Sons shares. The loan aims to refinance existing debts. PFC will have a lien on incomes from specific SP Group entities and dividends from Tata Sons. In case of a default, which the SP Group hasn’t done so far, govt through PFC will have a claim over Tata Sons shares.

text: The Indian government revised its long-term capital gains tax proposal for real estate, offering taxpayers the choice of a 20% tax with indexation benefits or a 12.5% tax without indexation. The investment will support new projects in Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, and Gujarat. FPEL already has 1.5 GW of green assets and plans more projects to aid India's energy transition.

Stalin also inspected an odour-free sewage pumping station, new classrooms, a commercial complex, and a special hospital in the Kolathur constituency.

text: Kerala justified constructing a weir at Vattavada, stating it would not harm Tamil Nadu farmers and the state is entitled to use its share of water in the Pambar sub-basin. text: Winning the three-match series is now beyond India's grasp, and the team will be determined to avoid a defeat in the final match of the series at Colombo's R Premadasa Stadium on Wednesday. The first match ended in a tie, while the Lankans won the second match by 32 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the series.
title: 3rd ODI: Will India stave off SL to keep 27-year record intact?

text: Bangladesh has been witnessing fierce demonstrations over a controversial quota system that reserves 30 per cent of jobs for the families of veterans who fought the 1971 liberation war. The World Cup in Bangladesh is scheduled to be held in Dhaka and Sylhet in October.

text: Vinod Kambli, a former dashing left-hander, made a significant impact in the 1990s with his explosive batting. He gained fame for his impressive performances in domestic cricket and international matches. He was known for his flamboyant style and played a crucial role in India's historic Test series win against England in 1993, scoring two centuries in a single match at Old Trafford.
title: 'Unwell' Vinod Kambli struggling to walk properly

text: Former England cricketer and coach Graham Thorpe passed away at 55. Known for his remarkable career, he played 100 Test matches and 82 ODIs for England. Thorpe's passing prompted tributes from cricket legends like Ben Stokes, Michael Vaughan, Anil Kumble, and Shaun Udal. He was also a key figure in coaching, contributing to England's 2019 ODI World Cup win.
title: 'Gone far too young...': Graham Thorpe remembered by cricketers

text: India's assistant coach Abhishek Nayar attributed the loss to Sri Lanka in the second ODI to spin-friendly conditions, highlighting the Indian team's challenges against spin bowling. Jeffrey Vandersay's six-wicket haul handed India a 32-run loss as they struggled to chase 241, ending at 208 all out. The Indian middle order failed to build partnerships, contributing to the defeat.

text: Former England batsman Graham Thorpe has passed away at the age of 55. The news of his demise was announced by the England and Wales Cricket Board. Thorpe, who played 100 Tests and 82 One-day internationals for England between 1993 and 2005, amassed 6,744 Test runs, including 16 centuries, with an average of 44.66.

text: In the second ODI between India and Sri Lanka, Sri Lanka won by 32 runs, taking a 1-0 lead in the series. A key moment was Shreyas Iyer's direct hit run out of Kamindu Mendis in the last over. India, despite restricting Sri Lanka to 240/9, faltered against spin and were bundled out for 208 in 42.2 overs.

text: India and Sri Lanka's three-match ODI series has been marred by controversy following a Decision Review System incident in the second ODI. The incident arose from a call involving Virat Kohli. Sri Lanka's spinner Jeffrey Vandersay's impressive performance, taking 6 for 33, helped bowl India out for 208 in 42.2 overs. However, the DRS decision left the Sri Lankan team frustrated.

text: Jeffrey Vandersay was brought into Sri Lanka’s ODI squad shortly before the second ODI against India, replacing Wanindu Hasaranga who was out with a hamstring injury. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

text: During the ECS Bulgaria T10 match, Afyonkarahisar SHS's Kursad Dalyan made a remarkable catch against VTU-MU Pleven. text: PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi responded to criticism about his cricketing knowledge, emphasizing his commitment to deliver results. He announced the formation of a six-member advisory board led by Waqar Younis and a new domestic cricket structure. Naqvi highlighted the importance of new initiatives aimed at improving domestic cricket and ensuring better international performance.

text: Sri Lanka defeated India by 32 runs, taking a 1-0 series lead. Jeffrey Vandersay's superb six-wicket haul for 33 runs dismantled the Indian batting lineup, leading to India’s collapse from 97 for 1 to 208 all out. Rohit Sharma's 64 and Shubman Gill's 35 set a strong foundation, but Vandersay's spin proved too challenging, dismissing key players including Sharma and Virat Kohli. Sri Lanka’s lower-order contributions and effective spin bowling were crucial in setting a competitive total and securing the win.
title: Jeffrey Vandersay grabs six as Sri Lanka sink India in second ODI

text: The second ODI between India and Sri Lanka in Colombo on Sunday saw a dramatic run-out of Akila Dananjaya off the last ball of home team's innings. text: Nasa's DART spacecraft captured detailed images of asteroids Dimorphos and Didymos just before it deliberately crashed. text: The FDA approved Guardant Health's Shield blood test for colon cancer screening, making it likely to be covered by Medicare and private insurers. text: Alligators and crocodiles, both belonging to different families within the Crocodylia genus, exhibited distinct traits despite their similarities. Key differences included snout shape, visibility of teeth, skin color, behavior, feet structure, and habitat preference. Alligators had U-shaped snouts and were less aggressive, while crocodiles possessed V-shaped snouts and were more territorial.

text: The ministry of social justice and empowerment proposed draft amendments to the RPwD Act, 2016, suggesting white UDID cards for disabilities below 40%. text: The State Excise Department in Ulhasnagar revoked a bar and restaurant licence recently given to a beer shop owner in Punjabi Colony. text: The government recently revised its plan to restrict construction on SDZ plots in Mumbai, limiting it to 65% instead of the previously planned 80%. text: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.
title: Dazzling Auroras possible as geomagnetic storms likely to hit earth

text: Nasa's DART spacecraft captured detailed images of asteroids Dimorphos and Didymos just before it deliberately crashed. The impact was part of a mission to gain new insights into these celestial bodies. Dimorphos, the smaller companion asteroid, has a surface covered with rocks of various sizes. Although Dimorphos lacks significant cratering, it features several cracks or "faults" across its surface.
title: Nasa's DART asteroid unlocks complex history of twin space rock targets; see pics

text: Kelly Haston, a 53-year-old biologist, completed a year-long NASA simulation called CHAPEA Mission 1 in Texas to study the impact of isolation on health and performance for future Mars missions. The crew, cut off from the outside world, conducted simulated Marswalks and grew crops. Haston reflected that separation from loved ones was the most challenging aspect.
title: One year on 'Mars': What did Nasa learn from CHAPEA Mission 1

text: The FDA approved Guardant Health's Shield blood test for colon cancer screening, making it likely to be covered by Medicare and private insurers. It is effective at detecting later-stage cancers but not early-stage polyps. A positive result requires follow-up with a colonoscopy. Doctors see potential for increased screening rates, but its impact on reducing mortality remains to be seen.
title: FDA approves blood test method for colon cancer screening

text: Alligators and crocodiles, both belonging to different families within the Crocodylia genus, exhibited distinct traits despite their similarities. Key differences included snout shape, visibility of teeth, skin color, behavior, feet structure, and habitat preference. Alligators had U-shaped snouts and were less aggressive, while crocodiles possessed V-shaped snouts and were more territorial.
title: Crocodiles vs. alligators: Spotting the differences

text: Carbon monoxide, a colorless and odorless gas, previously posed severe health risks when it accumulated in the bloodstream, causing tissues to be deprived of oxygen, leading to serious damage or death. Common sources included vehicles, gas appliances, and wood stoves. Symptoms such as headache and dizziness resembled flu without fever, making immediate medical attention crucial for suspected poisoning.
title: Why carbon monoxide is deadly; key facts to know

text: Armand 'Mondo' Duplantis captivated an 80,000-strong crowd at the Stade de France, setting a new world record of 6.25m in the pole vault. text: The Algerian boxer embroiled in a major gender controversy at the Paris Olympics won her semi-final on Tuesday to guarantee at least a silver medal in front of a raucous Roland Garros crowd that chanted her name. Imane Khelif defeated Thailand's 2023 world silver medallist Janjaem Suwannapheng in a unanimous points decision to march into Friday's final in the women's 66kg category. The 25-year-old Khelif and Lin both fought at the Tokyo Olympics three years ago but there was no controversy at the time and neither won a medal.

text: It was a dream chance for India to enter the final of the Olympics after 44 years but Germany played spoilsport to that. Skipper Harmanpreet Singh (7th) and Sukhjeet Singh (36th) scored for India, while Gonzalo Peillat (18th), Christopher Ruhr (27th) and Marco Miltkau (54th) were the scorers for Germany.

text: From being stretchered off in her debut at Rio 2016 to a disappointing performance in Tokyo in 2021, Vinesh Phogat has now come full circle by making history as the first Indian woman wrestler to reach the Olympic final.

text: The Indian men's hockey team came agonisingly close to making its first Olympic final after 44 years but world champion Germany denied it with a tight 3-2 win in a hard-fought semifinal. Aiming to better the colour of their medal won in Tokyo three years back, India created more opportunities but the Germans took their limited chances and exacted revenge for their Tokyo Games bronze play-off defeat. India got 11 penalty corners but converted only two while Germany converted one out of the four, apart from capitalising on a penalty stroke and a field goal.

text: Veteran India goalkeeper PR Sreejesh on Tuesday rued the missed chances in the action-packed Olympic semifinal against Germany but applauded his teammates for "standing tall" during a difficult match.

text: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen narrowly missed out on a bronze medal in the men’s singles event at the Paris 2024 Olympics, finishing fourth after a 21-13, 16-21, 11-21 loss to Malaysia's Zii Jia Lee. Despite a strong start, Sen couldn’t maintain his momentum and struggled against Jia's aggressive play in the final two sets. Reflecting on his journey, Sen expressed gratitude to his supporters and requested privacy to regroup, vowing to come back stronger and win future laurels for India.

text: Neeraj Chopra secured his place in the men's javelin throw final at the Olympic Games with a stellar season-best throw of 89.34m. Known for his consistent performances, Chopra easily surpassed the 84m automatic qualifying mark on his first attempt. In contrast, fellow Indian Kishore Jena fell short with a best throw of 80.73m.
title: Neeraj Chopra advances to the finals of the Paris Olympics

text: The Indian men's hockey team suffered a narrow 2-3 defeat against Germany in the Paris Olympics semifinals, ending their hopes of reaching the final after 44 years. Despite the disappointment, captain Harmanpreet Singh and veteran goalkeeper PR Sreejesh emphasized the importance of securing a bronze medal over returning empty-handed. Both players acknowledged costly mistakes that led to the loss but urged the team to focus on the upcoming bronze medal match. They also extended support to wrestler Vinesh Phogat ahead of her gold medal bout.

text: At the Paris Olympics, the men's 100m final saw all finalists clock sub-10-second finishes, with the top six surpassing Usain Bolt's peak speed of 27.8 mph. Despite these impressive feats, none came close to breaking Bolt's iconic 9.58-second world record. This highlights that sprinting excellence isn't just about raw speed but also about maintaining consistent acceleration, stride efficiency, and race strategy. Lyles' gold medal win at 9.79 seconds underscores this complex balance.

text: The only person in the world who can now stop Vinesh from becoming an Olympic gold medallist is Sarah Ann Hilderbrandt -- her American opponent in the final, with an impressive record. Sarah, who trains at the US Olympic and Paralympic Training Center in Colorado, has an interesting ritual when it comes to studying her opponents -- she makes flash cards.
title: Olympics: Who is Vinesh's gold-medal challenger Sarah Hiderbrandt

text: Lakshya Sen expressed gratitude and heartbreak on social media after losing the Men's Singles bronze medal match to Lee Zii Jia at the Paris Olympics 2024. He vowed to introspect and improve, thanking his team, coaches, and family for their unwavering support. His post went viral, receiving overwhelming messages of encouragement from fans.
title: Lakshya Sen's "honour and heartbreak" post from Paris Olympics that has gone viral

text: Indian markets saw strong gains on Wednesday, bolstered by a global rally. The Nifty 50 rose by 296.85 points and the BSE Sensex increased by 972.33 points. Almost all sectoral indices, including Nifty Bank and Nifty Auto, surged around 1%. Experts warn against trading amid volatility but note long-term potential for investors.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex surges 970 pts, Nifty above 24,250

text: India’s javelin throw star, Neeraj Chopra, advanced to the Paris Olympics final with an impressive throw. Fans and celebrities promise various rewards if he wins gold, led by cricketer Rishabh Pant’s pledge of Rs 100089. Atlys CEO Mohak Nahta vowed free visas if Chopra reaches the top podium, creating widespread excitement.
title: 'If Neeraj Chopra wins gold...': Pant leads social media trend

text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) warned the public about scams where criminals impersonated CBI officers to extort money. Using the agency's logo and senior officials' names, scammers created fake documents and WhatsApp calls. The CBI advised the public to remain vigilant, verify caller identities, and report suspicious activities to local authorities immediately.
title: CBI warns about this 'WhatsApp-CBI scam’; shares tips to stay protected

text: Vinesh Phogat made history by becoming the first Indian woman wrestler to reach the Olympic final. Following her victories, political leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, criticized the government for ignoring Phogat's past protests. Phogat's performance in the women's 50kg freestyle wrestling event has assured India of at least a silver medal at the Paris Olympics.
title: 'Will non-biological PM ...': Oppn attacks Modi govt after Phogat's win

text: Congress leader Salman Khurshid warned that India could face violent anti-government protests similar to those in Bangladesh. He referenced past protests like Shaheen Bagh and noted the ongoing struggles of its participants. Khurshid expressed doubts about future agitations achieving the same impact due to the suffering of those involved.
title: 'Violent protests like Bangladesh possible in India', warns Congress leader Salman Khurshid

text: The Supreme Court established a bench to address misconduct displayed by Punjab and Haryana High Court Judge Rajbir Sherawat. Justice Sherawat questioned the SC's authority, critiqued its influence over High Courts, and expressed doubts about the stay on his contempt proceedings. This intervention follows Sherawat's controversial July 17 order challenging SC's directives.
title: SC bristles, mulls action as Punjab & Haryana HC judge slams apex court

text: Following a significant political change in Bangladesh, many nationals rushed to return home from Kolkata. Sixty-seven passengers spent seven anxious hours at the airport before boarding the first flight at 1 am, with other flights and buses also departing later. Amid expectations for a new, democratic regime, some nationals, like Munir Hossain and Rafikul Hassan, expressed relief in being able to travel back. The airport’s flight operations faced disruptions, leading to frustrations for passengers like Al-Ameen Bin Naumiah. Ultimately, the anticipation and excitement to witness a transformative moment in Bangladesh's history were palpable among the returnees.
title: 'Looking forward to ...': 314 Bangladeshis staying in Bengal return home

text: Mumtaz says she never sulked when Rajesh Khanna worked with other actresses but he was protective of her and would get upset when she worked with other heroes. The actress didn't mind it, because it meant that he cared for her!
title: Mumtaz reveals Rajesh Khanna would get upset if she worked with other heroes

text: Hamas announced Yahya Sinwar as its new political leader on Tuesday, following the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh. Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 attack on Israel, is one of Israel's most wanted militants. The Ezzedine Al-Qassam Brigades subsequently fired rockets towards Israel from the Gaza Strip.
title: Hamas names new leader: What his appointment means for Gaza-Israel tensions?

text: The Algerian boxer embroiled in a major gender controversy at the Paris Olympics won her semi-final on Tuesday to guarantee at least a silver medal in front of a raucous Roland Garros crowd that chanted her name. Imane Khelif defeated Thailand's 2023 world silver medallist Janjaem Suwannapheng in a unanimous points decision to march into Friday's final in the women's 66kg category. The 25-year-old Khelif and Lin both fought at the Tokyo Olympics three years ago but there was no controversy at the time and neither won a medal.
title: Imane Khelif in gold medal match amid gender row

text: Hundreds of Bangladeshis in Kolkata, including students and tourists, expressed a desire for peace and unity amid unrest in their homeland. They emphasized the inclusive nature of the students' movement in Bangladesh and their disdain for violence and discrimination. Air India canceled all Dhaka flights after violent protests led to ex-Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina fleeing the country. Bangladeshis in Kolkata had mixed reactions, with some celebrating the Army's takeover while others expressed concern for their families back home. Flights to Dhaka from various airlines experienced disruptions due to the ongoing political crisis.
title: Let’s rebuild nation, protect rights: Plea from Kolkata's 'mini Bangladesh'

text: ​A 46-year-old Pakistani man, Asif Merchant, has been charged by the US Department of Justice for plotting to kill politicians, government officials on the US soil. Prosecutors in Brooklyn announced criminal charges against Asif Merchant, accusing him of travelling to New York for the purposes of trying to hire a hitman for the assassinations. The plot was disrupted before it could be carried out. The document did not name any potential target but CNN reported that former president Donald Trump and other current and former US government officials might be the targets of the plot.
title: Who is Asif Merchant? Pak man charged in Trump assassination plot

text: Niyati Fatnani shared her journey on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 14,' detailing challenging stunts involving honey bees and water, which led to her first panic attack. Despite her fears, she aimed to conquer her apprehensions and perform at her best. Her family's concern was evident, especially after seeing her discomfort caused by insects and bees during stunts.
title: Khatron Ke Khiladi 14's Niyati Fatnani on suffering a panic attack during a water stunt

text: A Bangladeshi woman, who arrived in India for a vacation, has been unable to return home due to unrest in Bangladesh following the fall of the Awami League government led by Sheikh Hasina. Her husband, a police officer, was called back to work amidst violent protests targeting police stations. Many officers have been killed, and the Bangladesh Police Subordinate Employees' Association announced an indefinite strike. The woman is anxious for her family's safety and is struggling to secure transport back home amidst the chaos and uncertainty in her country.
title: 'Feeling more unsafe': Bangladesh police officer's wife expresses fear

text: It was a dream chance for India to enter the final of the Olympics after 44 years but Germany played spoilsport to that. Skipper Harmanpreet Singh (7th) and Sukhjeet Singh (36th) scored for India, while Gonzalo Peillat (18th), Christopher Ruhr (27th) and Marco Miltkau (54th) were the scorers for Germany.
title: India's Olympic hockey final dream ends after 2-3 loss against Germany

text: The Congress party denied BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's claim that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attended a dinner hosted by the Ambani family in Mumbai. Dubey, however, reaffirmed his statement, stating that Vadra was present with her children. Congress leaders dismissed the claim, noting Vadra was not in India at the time.
title: Priyanka attended Ambani wedding, says BJP MP; Cong rubbishes it as ‘fake narrative’

text: The Indian government revised its long-term capital gains tax proposal for real estate, offering taxpayers the choice of a 20% tax with indexation benefits or a 12.5% tax without indexation. This amendment aims to address concerns from middle-class property owners and will apply to properties acquired before July 23, 2024.
title: Budget tweak: Govt to rework property capital gains formula

text: Vinesh Phogat (50kg) became first Indian woman wrestler to enter Olympic finals, beating Cuba's Yusneylis Guzman 5-0 in the semis. With the win, Vinesh has guaranteed herself at least a silver medal.
title: Vinesh becomes 1st Indian woman wrestler to reach Olympic final

text: Indian companies like Vodafone Idea and IndianOil have embraced AI across operations, enhancing efficiency and data handling. However, as AI's role grows, the need for robust governance becomes essential. Both companies have focused on data governance, privacy protection, and continuous system monitoring, while also implementing extensive employee training to ensure responsible AI use. To address this challenge and build trust in AI, Hitesh says, they implemented a data engineering process.
title: How some of India’s biggest companies deal with AI governance

text: Krishna Chivukula, an IIT-Madras alumnus and founder of Indo MIM Technology, donated Rs 228 crore to the institute. The funds will support fellowships for top BTech students, sportspersons, foreign students, and faculty conducting high-risk research. An academic block was named after him. This donation is one of the largest ever made to IIT-Madras.
title: Alumnus, a 1970 batch MTech, gifts IIT-M Rs 228 crore

text: Muhammad Yunus was appointed to lead Bangladesh's interim government after ex-Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina fled during a student-led uprising. The announcement followed President Mohammed Shahabuddin's dissolution of Parliament and the release of opposition leader Begum Khaleda Zia. The transition aims to restore normalcy and pave the way for fresh elections.
title: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus to head Bangladesh's interim govt

text: AISSC, representing Sufi shrines, supported the government's proposal to amend the Waqf Act, citing dargahs as victims of mismanagement and corruption. AISSC Chairman Syed Naseruddin Chishty emphasized the need for a separate dargah board under the law. They met officials and highlighted continuous legal battles faced by smaller dargahs, demanding wider consultations on the bill. They highlighted that smaller dargahs are often slapped with notices resulting in endless legal battles.
title: Sufi shrines body hails bid to amend Waqf Act

text: Suvendu Adhikari met home minister Amit Shah to discuss attacks on Hindus and temples in Bangladesh, emphasizing the necessity of CAA. Adhikari mentioned historical and ongoing persecution of Hindus in Bangladesh, referencing his family's migration during the 1971 war. Shah assured that the Centre is taking appropriate action and highlighted opposition parties' acknowledgment of CAA's need.
title: Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari calls on Amit Shah over attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh

text: India hosted the inaugural multi-nation Tarang Shakti air combat exercise at Sulur in Tamil Nadu. Featuring Rafale, Eurofighter Typhoon jets, and military aircraft from France, Germany, UK, and Spain, the exercise aims to enhance military interoperability and strategic partnerships. Phase-II will be held at Jodhpur after Phase-I ends on August 14.
title: India hosts its 1st-ever multination air drill

text: Amid protests from Manipur's Kuki community, two Assam Rifles battalions were withdrawn from sensitive buffer zones in the region and moved to Nagaland. The CRPF battalions, replacing them, will undergo extensive training, and are recommended to be placed under Assam Rifles' command for cohesive operations in Manipur, amid concerns over potential violence resurgence.
title: 2 Assam Rifles battalions moved out of Manipur ignoring tribals’ protests

text: The Union education minister Dharmendra Pradhan dismissed claims that the Preamble to the Constitution was removed from NCERT textbooks. He criticized Congress for spreading misinformation and urged critics to verify facts. NCERT clarified that the Preamble's removal from certain textbooks was untrue and emphasized new curriculum changes respecting the Constitution under National Education Policy.
title: Congress allegation of no Preamble in textbooks politics of lies: Pradhan

text: India imported approximately 18.6 lakh tonnes of urea valued at $730 million from China in 2023-24, along with 22.6 lakh tonnes of phosphatic and potassic fertilisers. MoS Anupriya Patel informed Rajya Sabha that India relies on imports to bridge the gap between production and demand. Efforts are underway to attain self-sufficiency through the revival of several fertiliser units.
title: India imported Rs 6,127 crore worth of urea from China in 2023-24

text: A Pithoragarh court sentenced Sunita Devi to life imprisonment for the murder of her husband, Jitendra Ram, two years ago. The case was confirmed by the couple’s daughter, who testified against her mother. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 50,000, with an additional five-year term if unpaid.
title: Life imprisonment for woman after daughter tells cops, court about father’s brutal murder

text: Pune police were directed by the Juvenile Justice Board to respond to a plea for the release of a Porsche Taycan involved in a crash that injured two techies, driven by a minor. The minor's release from observation home has been ordered, while his parents face charges. The police oppose releasing the car as the investigation continues.
title: JJB seeks cops’ response on Porsche release

text: Beer cans and soda bottles were discovered in a fridge meant for vaccines at a community health center in Bulandshahr’s Dharpa. Chief Medical Officer Vinay Kumar Singh confirmed the incident and announced an inquiry led by the additional CMO. He warned that those responsible would be held accountable for compromising vaccine safety.
title: Beer, not vaccines, in UP hospital fridge; probe ordered

text: The Supreme Court of India assigned the management of the Gokarna Mahabaleshwara temple in Karnataka to former judge B N Srikrishna and the Karwar district judge. The decision came after inter-group rivalry led to a stalemate. The court granted Srikrishna veto power, while the Karnataka government can replace the committee's private members chosen by the previous government.
title: SC entrusts Gokarna temple admin to judges

text: Velayudhan PT, a long-serving postman, visited the now-lost village of Mundakkai in Wayanad after a devastating tragedy only to find no trace of the dwellings and post office where he had worked for over three decades. His family narrowly escaped the disaster that obliterated his home and the village he had grown to call his own.
title: Mundakkai’s postman returns, but without any letter to deliver

text: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana, farmers have received Rs 1.6 lakh crore in insurance claims against Rs 32,440 crore in premiums since 2016-17. He emphasized the scheme's farmer-friendly and affordable nature, noting the introduction of a 12% penalty for delayed claim disbursal from the Kharif 2024 season.
title: Agri insurance claims worth 1.6 lakh crore cleared so far, says Shivraj Chouhan

His selection seeks to boost the party's focus on economic issues and appeal in battleground states.

text: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle planned a visit to Colombia after an invitation from Vice President Francia Márquez. Courtiers argued this visit strained their relationship with the royal family, accusing them of depicting themselves as British royals. The trip raised questions due to Colombia's high murder rate and Harry's ongoing security concerns in the UK.
title: Why did Royals blast Harry and Meghan citing ‘utter contempt’ towards the King?

text: Four Milwaukee hotel employees were charged with felony murder following D’Vontaye Mitchell’s death after they forcibly restrained him for eight to nine minutes. Mitchell, who struggled to breathe, ultimately succumbed to restraint asphyxia. The autopsy revealed drug use and morbid obesity as contributing factors. Arrest warrants have been issued for the employees involved.
title: Black man dies in Milwaukee hotel incident: 4 employees charged in case resonates with George Floyd's tragedy

text: Israel’s foreign minister Israel Katz on Tuesday called for the swift elimination of Yahya Sinwar, the new Hamas political leader. Sinwar, seen as a key figure behind the October 7 attack on Israel, was appointed after Ismail Haniyeh's death. Katz described Sinwar as an 'arch-terrorist' and emphasized the need to eradicate Hamas entirely. Sinwar's history and influence within Hamas make him a significant target for Israel.
title: Israel FM calls to 'swiftly eliminate' new Hamas leader and 'arch-terrorist' Yahya Sinwar

text: Following the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh witnessed mass protests and violent clashes. Protesters celebrated the dissolution of parliament, while unrest escalated, leading to numerous deaths and escape of prisoners. The military reshuffled commanders, and garment factories prepared to reopen, as life in Dhaka showed signs of returning to normalcy.
title: The day after, celebration & chaos on streets of Bangladesh

Maduro accused the platforms of promoting hatred and division and urged for social media regulation.

Now as his name was announced as Kamala Harris' running mate in the November election, a clip of his wife Gwen Walz speaking about the Black Lives Matter protest has gone viral with the Republicans claiming that the whole family is 'sick'.

Kamala Harris picking Minnesota governor Tim Walz "was her caving in to some of these darker parts in the party" in terms of appeasing "anti-Jewish bigots" that have "gotten marbled into this party", Van Jones said.
title: Van Jones says Kamala Harris picked Tim Walz over Josh Shapiro because...

text: Sri Lanka secured their first series win over India in 27 years with a 110-run victory in the third ODI at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium. The win was attributed to Sri Lanka's strategic advantage on home turf, exploiting spinning conditions to outplay India. The 2-0 series win was attributed to Sri Lankan spinner.
title: 'Indians usually play on good wickets and small boundaries'

text: In the final ODI in Colombo, Sri Lanka defeated India by 110 runs, securing their first bilateral ODI series win over India since 1997. Chasing 249, India collapsed to 138 all out in 26.1 overs, undone by Dunith Wellalage's five-wicket haul and Maheesh Theekshana’s spin. Despite a solid start from Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, and debutant Riyan Parag fell to Sri Lankan spinners. Earlier, Sri Lanka scored 248/7, led by Avishka Fernando’s 96 and Kusal Mendis’s 59.
title: Five-star Wellalage spins Lanka to historic series win over India

text: Sri Lanka secured a historic 110-run win over India in the third ODI in Colombo, clinching the series 2-0 and marking their first bilateral ODI series victory over India in 27 years. The Indian batting lineup struggled against Sri Lankan spinners throughout the series, losing a record 27 wickets to spin. Avishka Fernando's 96 and Dunith Wellalage's five-wicket haul led Sri Lanka to a total of 248/7, while India's chase collapsed at 138, despite Rohit Sharma's 35.
title: Despite Rohit and Virat, India's spin woes exposed by this stat

text: India's recent ODI series loss to Sri Lanka prompted captain Rohit Sharma to highlight the team's struggles against spin, emphasizing the need for adaptability and consistent opportunities for players. Acknowledging the tough pitches, Sharma stressed individual accountability and the importance of maintaining momentum, admitting the team failed to do so across all three matches. He hinted at potential personnel changes, focusing on players who can thrive in challenging conditions, and vowed to address the team's shortcomings moving forward.
title: 'If we need to be different in terms of...': Rohit Sharma

text: Spinner Dunith Wellalage took 5-27 as Sri Lanka clinched a first ODI series victory over India in 27 years with a 110-run thrashing of the tourists in the third match on Wednesday. Chasing 249 for victory, number one-ranked India suffered a third successive batting collapse in the three-match series to be bowled out for 138 in 26.1 overs at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium. Sri Lanka, who last registered a bi-lateral series triumph over India in the 50-over format in 1997, won the series 2-0 after the opener ended in a tie.
title: Disappointed Rohit says batters need to seriously look at plans against spin

text: Pakistan decided to retain senior players Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan, and Shaheen Shah Afridi in the Test squad for the Bangladesh series despite previous poor performance in the T20 World Cup. Shan Masood remains the red-ball captain, with Saud Shakeel as his deputy. The squad includes two uncapped players, with some players dropped due to inconsistent performance and injuries.
title: Pakistan Test squad for Bangladesh series includes senior players

text: The ICC considered relocating the Women's T20 World Cup from Bangladesh due to ongoing political instability and anti-government protests. Potential alternatives included UAE, Sri Lanka, and India. Given travel advisories and challenges such as monsoon season in Sri Lanka and visa issues in India, the ICC prioritized safety for all participants.
title: ICC considers relocating Women's T20 World Cup from Bangladesh

text: Bangladesh senior men's team two-Test away series against Pakistan starting August 21 in Rawalpindi looks doubtful due to the current civil unrest in the country after former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was forced to resign and flee the country.
title: Bangladesh tour of Pakistan looks doubtful amid political turmoil

text: Bangladesh has been witnessing fierce demonstrations over a controversial quota system that reserves 30 per cent of jobs for the families of veterans who fought the 1971 liberation war. The World Cup in Bangladesh is scheduled to be held in Dhaka and Sylhet in October.
title: Amid political unrest, ICC monitoring situation in Bangladesh ahead of Women's T20 WC

He was known for his flamboyant style and played a crucial role in India's historic Test series win against England in 1993, scoring two centuries in a single match at Old Trafford.
title: 'Unwell' Vinod Kambli struggling to walk properly

text: Former England cricketer and coach Graham Thorpe passed away at 55. Known for his remarkable career, he played 100 Test matches and 82 ODIs for England. Thorpe's passing prompted tributes from cricket legends like Ben Stokes, Michael Vaughan, Anil Kumble, and Shaun Udal. He was also a key figure in coaching, contributing to England's 2019 ODI World Cup win.

text: The Juvenile Justice Board determined that eight Somali pirates, who claimed to be minors, were actually adults aged between 19 and 21 after unreliable birth certificates and an ossification test. The Somali Embassy cited conflicting records supplied by a diplomat, who has been recalled. The suspects will be tried as adults alongside 27 others for hijacking a Bulgarian vessel.
title: Envoy’s record conflicting, 8 of 35 Somali pirates adults

text: The Supreme Court convicted an additional chief judicial magistrate and a Gujarat Police investigating officer for contempt of court after they disregarded an SC order granting anticipatory bail. Despite claiming a misunderstanding of the order, the SC determined that their actions were intentional and directed them to appear for sentencing.
title: Gujarat judge, investigating officer draw SC ire, held in contempt

text: "It's part of the game," a brave Vinesh Phogat told the Indian coaches who met her after her shock disqualification from the Paris Olympics for weighing 100g more than the permissible limit in the women's 50kg category in Paris on Wednesday.
title: Vinesh appeals against disqualification at CAS

text: Two extended Pakistani Hindu families entered India through the Attari border and moved to Jodhpur. A Jodhpur resident, Ashok, received 16 of his wife's relatives and five other members from Pakistan. They decided not to return due to concerns about possible attacks on Hindus in Pakistan, influenced by recent violence in Bangladesh.
title: 21 Hindus flee Pakistan, enter India through Attari border

text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed the Opposition's call to remove GST on health and life insurance, highlighting that three-quarters of the collected revenue goes to states. She reminded that taxes on medical insurance existed pre-GST and urged protesters to engage with state finance ministers. Around Rs 12,264 crore of collected GST last year went to states.
title: States get nearly 75% of health, life insurance GST: FM

text: Around 300-500 Indian medical students in Dhaka faced disruptions amid chaos, with some deciding to stay and help the wounded at hospitals. Promit Saha, interning in Dhaka, highlighted shortages of essentials while authorities offered support. Over 7,500 students have been evacuated, with the Indian high commission facilitating returns for those willing to leave.
title: Bangladesh crisis: Indian medical students in dilemma over return

text: Celebrated biochemist Govindarajan Padmanabhan was awarded the first 'Vigyan Ratna' for lifetime achievements, while Isro’s Chandrayaan-3 team received the inaugural 'Vigyan Team' award. The government announced 33 recipients for the 'Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar' 2024. The awards will be presented by President Droupadi Murmu on National Space Day, August 23, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
title: Govindarajan Padmanabhan to receive first Vigyan Ratna award

text: A mob attacked Bangladeshi folk singer Rahul Ananda's 140-year-old home in Dhaka, ransacking and setting it on fire, causing the loss of 3,000 handcrafted musical instruments. The incident forced Ananda and his family into hiding. The act has been widely condemned, with many stressing it tarnishes the country’s image amid ongoing protests against PM Sheikh Hasina's government.
title: Singer Rahul Ananda backed protest but his house too torched

text: The Madras High Court overturned the acquittal of DMK ministers KKSSR Ramachandran and Thangam Thennarasu in separate corruption cases. The court ordered them to appear at the Virudhunagar special court in September to face new charges. The court criticized the misuse of power to quash criminal charges and directed further investigation into the matter.
title: Madras high court overturns 2 DMK mantris’ acquittal in DA cases

text: In response to the Kanchanjungha Express tragedy, Indian Railways announced plans to implement unified rules for loco pilots concerning speed and precautions during signal failures. The railway will deploy the Kavach system on 5,000 km and install automatic train protection on 9,000 km track by March 2025. New trains will come pre-installed with Kavach 4.0.
title: Govt: Kavach on Delhi-Mumbai, Delhi-Howrah lines by Mar 2025

text: At IIT Bombay, core engineering careers gained popularity among graduates, with equal numbers entering industrial and tech firms. Job satisfaction and work-life balance were top priorities. Notably, many graduates praised the new curricula and research opportunities. Mumbai and Bengaluru were common post-graduation destinations. Placements were reported as stressful, and few graduates pursued entrepreneurship.
title: Is the old flavour back? Big chunk of IIT-B grads pick core industrial jobs

text: Andhra Pradesh removed the rule preventing people with more than two children from running in local and civic body elections. The state cabinet changed the 1994 laws to address declining population concerns. The move comes as delimitation, expected in 2026, may reduce Lok Sabha seats in southern states that have successfully controlled their populations, potentially impacting central funds distribution.
title: 3 decades on, Andhra removes 2-child norm for civic body polls

text: In the past three days, jailbreaks near the Indian border in Bangladesh have heightened security concerns. Over 700 inmates fled from three prisons, including Kashimpur Central Jail and Sherpur District Jail. Indian authorities, particularly the BSF, are conducting village coordination meetings and advising villagers to watch for suspicious activities to prevent infiltration.
title: 3 jailbreaks close to border in 3 days put BSF & cops on alert

title: US prisons face staff shortages as officers quit amid COVID

text: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.
title: Jack Karlson, man behind 'Succulent Chinese Meal' 'Democracy Manifest' viral video dies at 82
Why 'Paani Lagbe Paani’ is being used to memorialise a student killed in Bangladesh protests

text: Thousands of police officers were deployed across Britain on Wednesday to prevent potential unrest from far-right groups after recent anti-immigrant riots. Anti-racism demonstrators gathered in cities, and the evening passed without major incidents. Authorities arrested a few individuals, and Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned that those involved in violence would face strict legal consequences.
title: Thousands of anti-racism demonstrators take to UK streets after week of far-right violence
Watch: Protesters try to disrupt Kamala Harris's speech in Michigan. Her response

text: The newly appointed police chief of Bangladesh apologized for the actions of officers during recent deadly protests, promising an impartial investigation into the killings. He acknowledged unprofessional conduct by some officers and vowed disciplinary actions. The protests resulted in over 400 deaths, with many victims being young men with bullet wounds. A reshuffle in leadership aimed to restore order.
title: New police chief vows probe into protest deaths, offers apology
Walz’s long history with China in focus

text: During a campaign rally in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, Kamala Harris addressed chants of 'lock him up' directed at former President Donald Trump. Harris urged the crowd to let the courts handle Trump's legal issues and focus on winning the election. The rally highlighted her prosecutorial experience amid ongoing legal troubles for Trump.
title: Watch: Wisconsin crowd erupts in 'lock him up' chants – How Kamala Harris reacted

text: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, emphasized that Bangladesh's democracy and elections are untenable without the Awami League, the nation's oldest party. In a video message, he called for eliminating militancy and violence and underscored the need for his mother’s family’s involvement, urging party members to stay strong amid current unrest.
title: Democracy not possible without Awami League, says Hasina’s son
Yunus acquitted in labour law case

text: Carlos Yulo returned from the 2024 Paris Olympics with two gold medals and several rewards, including a three-bedroom condo and a lifetime supply of ramen. The 24-year-old gymnast made history by winning the men’s floor and vault events, adding two medals to the Philippines' tally. His achievements were recognized with significant perks and cash rewards.
title: Philippines' Carlos Yulo gets lifetime supply of ramen for winning Olympic gold

text: An interim government led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was decided at a meeting in Bangabhaban with military leaders and student representatives. Former PM Sheikh Hasina resigned amid mass protests. Yunus, known for establishing Grameen Bank, aims to guide Bangladesh through its current crisis, despite past legal issues and his removal from the bank in 2011.
title: Mohammed Yunus is set to be 32nd Nobel laureate to be a head of state

text: A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Southern California on Tuesday night, with its epicentre near Mettler in Kern County. It was widely felt across the region, including Los Angeles. The initial shock was followed by strong aftershocks. No significant damage or injuries were reported. The quake was the strongest in the region in three years.
title: What's behind strongest tremors felt in Southern California in years

text: US President Joe Biden expressed doubts about a smooth transition to Vice President Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses the November 5 election. In an interview, Biden said, "He means what he says. We don't take him seriously. He means it. All this stuff about if we lose there'd be a bloodbath," Biden added."
title: Biden says he is 'not confident' of peaceful power transfer if Trump loses presidential election

text: The newspaper cover adds to the identity confusion as Kamala Harris has been depicted with the Red Indian headgear. Editor-in-chief Tommaso Cerno explained the cover and said there was no confusion over Kamala Harris' origin. Kamala Harris was described with the headgear because 'redskins' are the symbol par excellence of all America's minorities who are "galvanized" by her candidacy.
title: Italy's newspaper depicts Kamala Harris as 'Red Indian', defends action

text: Both JD Vance and Kamala Harris landed at the same airport in Wisconsin on Wednesday around the same time. But then something 'weird' happened on the tarmac as JD Vance walked over to Air Force Two -- vice president Kamala Harris' plane. The reporters who were travelling with Kamala Harris-Tim Walz were surprised and JD Vance had a ready reply for them.
title: Did JD Vance just check Kamala Harris' plane out? 'Going to be mine'. Watch

text: Taylor Swift's upcoming concerts at Vienna were one of the targets of major ISIS plot which has been foiled with the arrest of two men by Austrian federal and state police. Taylor Swift's concerts will take place as scheduled, the police said. Swift is scheduled to perform at the Ernst-Happel-Stadion in Vienna on Thursday, Friday and Saturday for the international leg of The Eras Tour.
title: ISIS terror plot at Taylor Swift concert in Vienna foiled, 2 arrested

text: Pakistan announced its communication with US authorities regarding a Pakistani national's alleged role in a failed plot to assassinate former President Donald Trump. The US Justice Department charged Asif Raza Merchant, who allegedly has connections with Tehran. Merchant purportedly sought to recruit individuals for the plot as retaliation for the killing of Iran’s Qasem Soleimani in 2020. He told investigators he has a wife and children in Iran and a separate family in Pakistan.
title: Karachi banker with Iran ties in foiled plot to kill Trump

text: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance accused Tim Walz of misleading the country about his veteran status and said he did not actually serve in the army and dropped out when he was asked to go to Iraq. The comment came as Walz made fun of JD Vance's Yale degree followed by his bestseller book attacking the elites.
title: JD Vance says Tim Walz lied about military service: 'I went to Iraq but he...'
